overview: Reduced Earnings Allowance can help if you income falls because of a work-related accident or disease - what you'll get, eligibility and how to claim
title: Reduced Earnings Allowance

table.body:
Reduced Earnings Allowance compensates for lack of earnings if you're unable to earn as much as you used to because of an accident or disease caused by your work.

You can only get it for accidents that happened, or diseases that started, before 1 October 1990.
table.title: Overview

table.body:
£60.12 per week is the maximum rate you’ll get. You may also be able to get [Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit](/industrial-injuries-disablement-benefit "Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit").

Your individual circumstances can affect the amount you get, eg whether or not you're working. You'll need to contact your regional [Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit Centre](/reduced-earnings-allowance/further-information "Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit Centre") for more details.

Reduced Earnings Allowance will be replaced by another benefit called Retirement Allowance if all the following apply:

- you get more than £2 a week Reduced Earnings Allowance 
- you reach State Pension age
- you're not in regular employment

##How Reduced Earnings Allowance is paid##

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid into an account, eg your bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
You may qualify for Reduced Earnings Allowance if you're suffering from an illness or disability caused by a work-related accident or disease that happened before 1 October 1990.

To get Reduced Earnings Allowance you must meet all of the following:

- have an assessment of disablement of at least 1% - your level of disability is assessed by a doctor on a scale of 1 to 100% 
- be incapable of returning to your regular occupation 
- be unable to carry out other work producing the same level of earnings as your regular occupation

##Going abroad##

If you leave the UK to live permanently outside the European Economic Area, you won't be able to get Reduced Earnings Allowance.

But if it's a temporary visit, you can usually claim for the first 3 months of your stay. This can be longer in special circumstances, but you'll need to check with the International Pensions Centre to see if you qualify.

$C**International Pensions Centre**

**Telephone:** 0191 218 7777  
**Textphone:** 0191 218 7021  

Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm$C
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
Claim straight away or you might lose benefit, you can download a claim form (BI103). 

$D[Download 'Reduced Earnings Allowance claim form BI103' (PDF, 239KB)](http://dwp.gov.uk/docs/bi103-print.pdf "Reduced Earnings Allowance claim form")$D

The form comes with notes that will help you fill it in and tell you where to send it. 

You can also contact your regional [Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit Centre](/reduced-earnings-allowance/further-information "Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit Centre") for a claim form.

If you want help filling in your claim form, ring the Benefit Enquiry Helpline for disabled people and their carers.

$C**Benefit Enquiry Helpline**

**Telephone:** 0800 88 22 00  
**Textphone:** 0800 24 33 55

Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 6:30pm$C

##Effect on other benefits and entitlements##

Reduced Earnings Allowance may affect any income-related benefits you or your partner are getting, eg:

- Child Tax Credit
- Council Tax Benefit
- Housing Benefit
- income-based Employment and Support Allowance
- income-based Jobseeker's Allowance
- Income Support
- Pension Credit 
- Working Tax Credit

[Contact Jobcentre Plus](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=2&lang=en "contact Jobcentre Plus"){:rel="external"} for more details.

##If your circumstances change##

Tell your regional Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit Centre straight away if your circumstances change. Some examples of the changes you need to report include:

- stopping or starting working 
- changing your occupation 
- a change in the level of your earnings

##What else you need to know##

There is another kind of benefit, [Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit](/industrial-injuries-disablement-benefit "Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit"), for people who have become disabled as a result of an accident or disease at work.

For advice you can call the Benefit Enquiry Helpline. This is a confidential advice service for disabled people and their carers.

$C**Benefit Enquiry Helpline**
**Telephone:** 0800 88 22 00  
**Textphone:** 0800 24 33 55  
Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 6:30pm$C

*[IIDB]: Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit
